speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Enter IMOGEN and PISANIO

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I would thou grew'st unto the shores o' the haven,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And question'dst every sail: if he should write

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And not have it, 'twere a paper lost,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As offer'd mercy is. What was the last

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That he spake to thee?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: It was his queen, his queen!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Then waved his handkerchief?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: And kiss'd it, madam.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Senseless Linen! happier therein than I!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And that was all?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: No, madam; for so long

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: As he could make me with this eye or ear

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Distinguish him from others, he did keep

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: The deck, with glove, or hat, or handkerchief,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Still waving, as the fits and stirs of 's mind

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Could best express how slow his soul sail'd on,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: How swift his ship.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou shouldst have made him

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As little as a crow, or less, ere left

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To after-eye him.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Madam, so I did.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I would have broke mine eye-strings; crack'd them, but

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To look upon him, till the diminution

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of space had pointed him sharp as my needle,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Nay, follow'd him, till he had melted from

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The smallness of a gnat to air, and then

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have turn'd mine eye and wept. But, good Pisanio,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When shall we hear from him?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Be assured, madam,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: With his next vantage.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I did not take my leave of him, but had

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Most pretty things to say: ere I could tell him

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: How I would think on him at certain hours

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Such thoughts and such, or I could make him swear

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The shes of Italy should not betray

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Mine interest and his honour, or have charged him,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: At the sixth hour of morn, at noon, at midnight,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To encounter me with orisons, for then

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am in heaven for him; or ere I could

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Give him that parting kiss which I had set

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Betwixt two charming words, comes in my father

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And like the tyrannous breathing of the north

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Shakes all our buds from growing.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter a Lady

speaker: Lady
text_entry: The queen, madam,

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Desires your highness' company.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Those things I bid you do, get them dispatch'd.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I will attend the queen.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Madam, I shall.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exeunt
